page.title: 12EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Our main industry is farming, but mechanisation has meant that there are far fewer employment opportunites on the farms than there used to be. A few people work in shops or offices in Rye or Hastings, also in the hotels and restaurants. There is usually casual work to be had picking soft fruit or apples in the season. Many young people, however, leave the area altogether in order to seek employment. For this reason we are now part of a 'Rural Development Area' for which government funds are to be made available to help small indust_ ries get started. Our old school building is to be turned into craft workshops. The County Joinery, which operates in the old Methodist Chapel, employs four men. It is just possible to commute to London to work. A few men work for local building firms.
